response:
<<<api>>>: Iterator.next
<<<code>>>: for(Iterator<Item> it = myArray.iterator(); it.hasNext(); ){
    Item count = it.next();
    if(count.getName().contains(name) && currentRoom.hasItem() == false){
        currentRoom.addItem(count);
        currentMessage = "you have successfully dropped the item in the room";
        myArray.remove(count);
    }
    else if(count.getName().contains(name) && currentRoom.hasItem() == true)
    {
        currentMessage = "the room already has an item";
    }
    else
    {
        currentMessage = "you do not have that item";
    }
}
<<<explanation>>>: The problem with your code is that you are using the value of the iterator in the if statement, but you are not using it in the else if statement. Also, you are using the value of the iterator in the for loop, but you are not using it in the if statement. You should use the value of the iterator in the if statement and use the value of the iterator in the else if statement.
